Container.Name: HandBrake
Container.Overview:
HandBrake is a tool for converting video from nearly any format to a selection of modern, widely supported codecs.
The graphical user interface (GUI) of the application can be accessed through a modern web browser, requiring no installation or configuration on the client side, or via any VNC client.
The container is built against Alpine Linux to provide an efficient image in terms of size and resource usage.
A fully automated mode is also available: drop files into a watch folder and let HandBrake process them without any user interaction.
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake#readme

Config.Name: Output Directory
Config.Description: The destination for converted video files.

Config.Name: Trash Directory
Config.Description: When trash usage is enabled, converted source files are moved here instead of being deleted.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask controlling permissions for newly created files and folders, specified in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest, 19 is the lowest and 0 the default. NOTE: Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, "--cap-add=SYS_NICE" must be added to Extra Parameters (shown when Advanced View is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Dark Mode
Config.Description: When set to "1", enables dark mode for the application.

Config.Name: Web Audio
Config.Description: When set to "1", enables audio support, allowing audio produced by the application to play through the browser. Note that this feature is not supported for VNC clients.

Config.Name: Web File Manager
Config.Description: When set to "1", enables the web file manager, allowing interaction with files inside the container through a web browser, supporting operations like renaming, deleting, uploading, and downloading. Note that this feature is not supported for VNC clients.

Config.Name: Web File Manager Allowed Paths
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of paths within the container that the file manager can access. By default, the container's entire filesystem is not accessible, and this variable specifies allowed paths. If set to "AUTO", commonly used folders and those mapped to the container are automatically allowed. The value "ALL" allows access to all paths (no restrictions).

Config.Name: Web File Manager Denied Paths
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of paths within the container that the file manager cannot access. A denied path takes precedence over an allowed path.

Config.Name: Web Desktop Notifications
Config.Description: When set to '1', enables the web notification service, allowing the browser to display desktop notifications from the application. Note that this feature is not supported for VNC clients.

Config.Name: Web Authentication
Config.Description: When set to "1", protects the application's GUI with a login page when accessed via a web browser. Access is granted only with valid credentials. Note that this feature is not supported for VNC clients.

Config.Name: Web Authentication Token Validity Time
Config.Description: Lifetime of a token, in hours. A token is assigned to the user after successful login. As long as the token is valid, the user can access the application's GUI without logging in again. Once the token expires, the login page is displayed again.

Config.Name: Web Authentication Username
Config.Description: Optional username for web authentication. Provides a quick and easy way to configure credentials for a single user. For more secure configuration or multiple users, see the documentation.

Config.Name: Web Authentication Password
Config.Description: Optional password for web authentication. Provides a quick and easy way to configure credentials for a single user. For more secure configuration or multiple users, see the documentation.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: When set to "1", uses an encrypted connection to access the application's GUI (via web browser or VNC client).

Config.Name: Secure Connection VNC Method
Config.Description: Method used for encrpyted VNC connection. Possible values are "SSL" or "TLS".

Config.Name: Secure Connection Certificate Check Interval
Config.Description: Interval, in seconds, at which the system checks if web or VNC certificates have changed. When a change is detected, affected services are automatically restarted. A value of "0" disables the check.

Config.Name: Web Listening Port (Non-Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port used by the web server to serve the application's GUI. This port is internal to the container and typically does not need to be changed. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to something else than Bridge.

Config.Name: VNC Listening Port (Non-Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port used by the VNC server to serve the application's GUI. This port is internal to the container and typically does not need to be changed. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to something else than Bridge.

Config.Name: HandBrake GUI State
Config.Description: Setting this to "1" enables the HandBrake GUI, "0" disables it.

Config.Name: HandBrake GUI State
Config.Description: Action to be taken on the HandBrake GUI queue at startup. When set to "PROCESS", HandBrake automatically starts encoding items in the queue. When set to "CLEAR", the queue is cleared. Any other value results in no action on the queue.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: State
Config.Description: Setting this to "1" enables the automatic video converter, "0" disables it.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Preset
Config.Description: Preset used by the automatic video converter. The preset must be identified in the format 'CATEGORY/PRESET NAME'. Available presets can be seen via the HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Format
Config.Description: Video container format used by the automatic video converter for output files, typically the video filename extension.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Keep Source Files
Config.Description: When set to "0", a successfully converted video is removed from the watch folder.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Video File Extensions
Config.Description: Space-separated list of file extensions considered as video files. By default, this list is empty, allowing HandBrake to automatically detect if a file is a video, regardless of its extension (except for extensions defined by the Non-Video File Extensions list, which are always considered non-video). This variable is typically unnecessary but useful when only specific video files need conversion.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Non-Video File Action
Config.Description: When set to "ignore", non-video files in the watch folder are ignored. If set to "copy", non-video files are copied as-is to the output folder.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Non-Video File Extensions
Config.Default: jpg jpeg bmp png gif txt nfo
Config.Description: Space-separated list of file extensions considered non-video. Most non-video files are properly rejected by HandBrake, but some files, like images, may be convertible despite not being videos.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Watch Directory
Config.Description: Path to the watch directory within the container. When set to "AUTO" (the default), the path is set to "/watch" for the first watch directory and "/watchX" for additional ones, where "X" is the index (e.g., "2" for the second).

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Output Directory
Config.Description: Root directory inside the container where converted videos are written.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Output Subdirectory
Config.Description: Subdirectory of the output folder where converted videos are written. By default, videos are saved directly to "/output/". If set to "Home/Movies", videos are written to "/output/Home/Movies". Use "SAME_AS_SRC" to match the source subfolder. For example, if the source is "/watch/Movies/MyMovie/MyMovie.mkv", the output is written to "/output/Movies/MyMovie/".

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Overwrite Destination
Config.Description: When set to "1", allows overwriting an existing destination file.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Source File Stable Time
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) during which properties (e.g., size, time) of a video file in the watch folder must remain unchanged to avoid processing a file being copied.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Minimum Title Duration
Config.Description: Minimum title duration (in seconds). Shorter titles are ignored. Applies only to video disc sources (ISO files, "VIDEO_TS" folders, or "BDMV" folders).

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Main Title Detection
Config.Description: When set to "1", enables HandBrake's main feature title detection to guess and select the main title. Applies only to video disc sources (ISO files, "VIDEO_TS" folders, or "BDMV" folders).

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Check Interval
Config.Description: Interval (in seconds) at which the automatic video converter checks for new files.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Number of Watch Folders
Config.Description: Maximum number of watch folders handled by the automatic video converter.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Disable Progress in GUI
Config.Description: When set to "1", progress of videos converted by the automatic video converter is not shown in the HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Custom HandBrake Arguments
Config.Description: Custom arguments to pass to HandBrake during conversion.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Use Trash Directory
Config.Description: When set to "1", the automatic video converter uses the trash directory. This applies only when the converter is configured not to keep source files. In that case, they will be moved to the trash directory ("/trash" inside the container by default) instead of being permanently deleted.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Trash Directory
Config.Description: Location of the trash directory inside the container.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI (Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port to access the application's GUI via the web interface. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to "Bridge".

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI (Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port to access the application's GUI via VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to "Bridge".
